Data Repository: Platforms that allow to upload research datasets to make them citable and reusable.
Micropublication: Aimed for stand-alone observations and small studies, inluding those with negative/neutral results and does not require a narrative story.
Preprint publication: Platforms for yet unpublished research manuscripts that allow an immediate visibility of the results.
Data journals: Journal article that focuses on presenting a dataset together with metadata and the methods used to aquire the dataset.
Publishing platform: Articles are published without editorial filtering; peer-review happens after (immediate) publication of article.
Journal open to null results: Traditional journals that also publish null results.

Data Repository: Zenodo, FigShare or Dryad, use re3data to search for disciplinary repositories
Data journals: Scientific Data, Data, Data in Brief, many disciplinary journals (e.g. GigaScience)
Journal open to null results: PeerJ, PLoS One, multiple BMC journals and many other disciplinary journals

Micropublication: citations of article  + article in publication list (future handling of such articles is open)
Preprint publication: citations of article  + article in publication list (not universally accepted at this point)
Data journals: citations of article  + article in publication list
Publishing platform: citations of article  + article in publication list (not universally accepted at this point)
Journal open to null results: citations of article  + article in publication list

Outlet: Publishing venue can have Impact Factor

Micropublication: integrated open data upload, reviewer compensation, often only one reviewer
